text: What feeling is so nice as a child's hand in yours? So small, so soft and warm, like a kitten huddling in the shelter of your clasp.
author: Marjorie Holmes

text: We expect teachers to handle teenage pregnancy, substance abuse, and the failings of the family. Then we expect them to educate our children.
author: John Sculley

text: I think I'm going to have to live vicariously through my daughter's rebellion because I certainly never did go through adolescence.
author: Brooke Shields

text: Do you want to be an artist and a writer, or a wife and a lover? With kids, your focus changes. I don't want to go to PTA meetings.
author: Stevie Nicks

text: Believe me, my children have more stamina than a power station.
author: Robbie Coltrane
